body:
Feature gate: `#![feature(get_many_mut)]`

This is a tracking issue for `get_many_mut` and `get_many_unchecked_mut`, which provide `&mut T` access to multiple distinct slice elements.

### Public API

<!--
For most library features, it'd be useful to include a summarized version of the public API.
(E.g. just the public function signatures without their doc comments or implementation.)
-->

```rust
impl [T] {
    pub unsafe fn get_many_unchecked_mut<const N: usize>(&mut self, indices: [usize; N]) -> [&mut T; N];
    pub unsafe fn get_many_mut<const N: usize>(&mut self, indices: [usize; N]) -> Result<[&mut T; N], GetManyMutError<N>>;
}

pub struct GetManyMutError<const N: usize> { /* private */ }
```

### Steps / History

- [ ] Implementation:
    - Initial implementation in #83608, also received extensive discussion
- [ ] Final comment period (FCP)[^1]
- [ ] Stabilization PR

### Unresolved Questions

- What should the error type / return type look like?
  -  See https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/83608#issuecomment-914619139, https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/83608#issuecomment-861382045, and other comments on that PR
- Should the interface support non-usize indices (e.g., `get_many_mut([0..3, 4..6])`)?
- What are the requirements for the interface? Do we sort the passed array, and then check distinctness, or check in `O(n^2)` time?

[^1]: https://std-dev-guide.rust-lang.org/feature-lifecycle/stabilization.html
